title: English Language Testing Planner - NYC (On-site)
description:
Under the direction of the Service Delivery Manager and Academic Specialist, the English Language Testing Planner demonstrates commitment and passion to quality language instruction and education, representing as an expert in teaching and ambassador for Berlitz. The Instructor teaches the required languages to assigned classes of students and provides student support in accordance with Berlitz's teaching and customer service principles as well as administering tests and planning of the programs.



The candidate will start ASAP, twice a week, Tuesdays and Thursdays.


**This is a U.S. based job**


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Deliver lessons in-person in accordance with Berlitz teaching principles: focusing on the goals, needs, and interests of students.
* Meet with Academic Specialist regularly to participate in lesson evaluation and coaching plans to strengthen teaching skills and ensure SMART goals are met.
* Administer testing and planning of programs.
* Perform duties as deemed fit for proper execution and delegated by the Service Delivery Manager or Academic Specialist.


**QUALIFICATIONS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience.
* Teaching experience is required.
* Ability to speak native-like English
* Exceptional communication skills.
* Basic administrative skills, and computer knowledge to deliver lessons, and maintain student records.


**SALARY:** $22.00 - $31.00 an hour


**WORK ENVIRONMENT:** This job operates in a professional office environment. This role routinely uses standard office equipment such as computers, phones, photocopiers, filing cabinets, and fax machines

  


**Please note, that the above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by most people assigned to this job. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all duties responsibilities and requirements. Other duties may be assigned at Supervisor's discretion.**


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)
company_description: Get the language skills, cultural understanding and confidence to open up your world with Berlitz.

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
**About Us:** At New York Medical and Diagnostic Center, we are committed to providing exceptional care to our patients. Our physical therapy department is known for its dedication to improving patient outcomes and promoting overall wellness. We are currently seeking a compassionate and motivated Physical Therapy Aide to join our dynamic team.

**Job Description:** As a Physical Therapy Aide, you will play a vital role in supporting our physical therapists/chiropractors in delivering high-quality care to our patients. Your responsibilities will include assisting with patient preparation, setting up and maintaining therapy equipment, and ensuring a clean and safe environment for therapy sessions. This position is ideal for individuals who are passionate about healthcare and are looking to make a difference in the lives of others.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Assist physical therapists/chiropractors with patient care, including preparing patients for treatment and assisting during exercises and therapies.
* Set up, maintain, and clean therapy equipment and treatment areas before and after each session.
* Ensure a safe and organized environment for patients and staff.
* Provide support with patient documentation and record-keeping as needed.
* Assist patients with mobility and comfort during therapy sessions.
* Communicate effectively with patients and staff to ensure smooth operation of the physical therapy department.
* Perform other duties as assigned by the physical therapy/chiropractic team.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent.
* Previous experience as a Physical Therapy Aide or in a healthcare setting is preferred but not required.
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
* Ability to work well in a team-oriented environment.
* Physical ability to assist patients with mobility and lift or move equipment as needed.
* CPR certification is a plus.
* A genuine interest in healthcare and patient wellness.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive salary based on experience.
* Paid time off and holidays after 6 months of work.
* Opportunities for professional development and growth within the organization.
* A supportive and collaborative work environment.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $17.00 - $21.00 per hour

Ability to Commute:

* Kew Gardens, NY 11415 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Logistics Technology Specialist
description:
**Job Title: C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) Super User (*****Logistics Technology Specialist*****)** 

**Job Summary:**

The C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) Super User serves as the primary subject matter expert for the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) logistics platform within the organization. They are responsible for providing advanced support, system optimization, and ensuring that users maximize the platform’s capabilities. The role involves troubleshooting, training, and acting as a liaison between end users and IT teams to ensure seamless integration and system updates.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* **System Expertise**: Develop and maintain deep knowledge of the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) system, including all modules and functionalities relevant to logistics and supply chain processes.
* **User Support**: Provide advanced support to end users, resolving complex issues related to system usage, and troubleshooting any technical problems.
* **Training & Onboarding**: Train new users and provide ongoing support to existing users to ensure they understand the system and can fully utilize its features.
* **Process Improvement**: Work with various departments to identify areas where C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) can be better leveraged to improve workflows and operational efficiency.
* **Data Management**: Ensure accurate data entry, data integrity, and reporting within the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) system.
* **Customization & Configuration**: Collaborate with IT or external vendors to customize the platform based on business needs, configuring workflows, reports, and system settings.
* **Testing & Implementation**: Participate in the testing and implementation of system updates, patches, and new features, ensuring that any changes do not disrupt existing operations.
* **Liaison Role**: Act as the bridge between C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) users, IT, and external vendors, conveying user feedback and system performance issues to the appropriate teams.
* **Reporting & Analytics**: Assist in creating and maintaining reports, dashboards, and KPIs to provide insights into business performance through the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) platform.

**Key Skills & Qualifications:**

* **Technical Proficiency**: In-depth knowledge of the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) platform, with the ability to troubleshoot and optimize its use.
* **Logistics/Operations Knowledge**: Strong understanding of logistics, transportation, or supply chain processes, and how these align with system capabilities.
* **Problem Solving**: Ability to identify issues and develop solutions within the platform, whether it’s user error or system limitations.
* **Communication**: Strong communication skills to train users, provide clear documentation, and act as a liaison with IT teams.
* **Project Management**: Experience in managing system updates or improvements, ensuring minimal disruption to operations.
* **Experience**: Prior experience in logistics or supply chain roles, ideally using the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) platform or a similar system.

**Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor’s degree in logistics, supply chain management, IT, or related fields.
* 3+ years of experience using the C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) platform or similar logistics software.
* Experience in a super user, systems administrator, or training role is preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Experience:

* C3 (DMS/YMS Solution) platform: 4 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Englewood Cliffs, NJ 07632 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Englewood Cliffs, NJ 07632: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: iLEVEL Commercial Strategy
description:
**About the Role:**  

**Grade Level (for internal use):** 10
  
  

**The Team:**  

The Markets segment sits within S&P Global Market Intelligence and provides clients with industry-leading software and services, covering enterprise data management, investment management, loans software & services and private markets solutions.
  
  

The segment is comprised of a diverse set of enterprise software, SaaS, data, and service offerings that serve clients’ investment management workflows.
  
  

The iLEVEL commercial team is responsible for overall strategy and go-to-market for the entire iLEVEL Private Markets solutions suite. The team is also responsible for identifying potential partnerships and M&A candidates as we look at new areas of opportunity. Our team works in a fast-paced, dynamic environment that fosters growth, knowledge building, collaboration, and teamwork.
  
  

**Responsibilities and Impact:**  

Gathering feedback from clients and internal stakeholders to influence the roadmaps for iLEVEL, Managed Data Services, and new offerings.
  
  

Supporting the General Partner segment’s Sales, Marketing, Software, and Services operations in a high-execution capacity.
  
  

Leading initiatives to generate new business, support existing clients, and contribute to cross-department synergy opportunities.
  
  

Working with external strategic partners to define requirements for integrations, referrals, and similar arrangements.
  
  

Supporting Sales opportunities with Private Equity, Private Credit, Real Assets, and Non-Correlated asset managers.
  
  

**Compensation/Benefits Information:** (This section is only applicable to US candidates)
  
S&P Global states that the anticipated base salary range for this position is $80,109.00 to $140,477.25. Final base salary for this role will be based on the individual’s geographic location, as well as experience level, skill set, training, licenses and certifications.
  
  

In addition to base compensation, this role is eligible for an annual incentive plan.
  
  

This role is eligible to receive additional S&P Global benefits. For more information on the benefits we provide to our employees, please click here .
  
  

**What We’re Looking For:****Basic Required Qualifications:**  

Minimum of 4+ years of experience in roles within commercial strategy, sales, sales leadership, business development or similar
  
  

May have previous experience on client side as a consumer of similar (SPGI Software Solution or other) products and services
  
  

Expertise working within the Private Markets marketplace; experience with General Partners (GP) is a plus
  
  

Experience with market analysis, strategy definition and execution
  
  

Must be a team player with proven ability to collaborate with a cross-functional team
  
  

Strong ability to set clear strategic direction, create followership, and can navigate a large organization to collaborate with and empower teams and stakeholders to achieve common objectives
  
  

Commercial, results-oriented and self-starter
  
  

Strong ability to partner and collaborate both externally and internally. Team player with the ability to successfully operate independently and collaborate closely with teammates and colleagues across global regions, various business lines and functions.
  
  

Open minded, flexible, and willing to adapt to changing situations
  
  

Strong written and verbal communication skills are required in order to be successful in the role.
  
  

Ability to communicate effectively across different stakeholder groups, both verbally and in writing
  
  

Strong presentation skills
  
  

**Right to Work Requirements:**  

This role is limited to persons with indefinite right to work in the United States.
  
  

**Return to Work:**  

Have you taken time out for caring responsibilities and are now looking to return to work? As part of our Return to Work initiative, Restart, we are encouraging enthusiastic and talented returners to apply, and will actively support your return to the workplace.
  
  

About S&P Global Market Intelligence
  
  

At S&P Global Market Intelligence, a division of S&P Global we understand the importance of accurate, deep and insightful information. Our team of experts delivers unrivaled insights and leading data and technology solutions, partnering with customers to expand their perspective, operate with confidence, and make decisions with conviction.
  
  

For more information, visit www.spglobal.com/marketintelligence .
  
  

What’s In It For You?
  
  

**Our Purpose:**  

Progress is not a self-starter. It requires a catalyst to be set in motion. Information, imagination, people, technology–the right combination can unlock possibility and change the world.
  
  

Our world is in transition and getting more complex by the day. We push past expected observations and seek out new levels of understanding so that we can help companies, governments and individuals make an impact on tomorrow. At S&P Global we transform data into Essential Intelligence®, pinpointing risks and opening possibilities. We Accelerate Progress.
  
  

**Our People:**  

We're more than 35,000 strong worldwide—so we're able to understand nuances while having a broad perspective. Our team is driven by curiosity and a shared belief that Essential Intelligence can help build a more prosperous future for us all.
  
  

From finding new ways to measure sustainability to analyzing energy transition across the supply chain to building workflow solutions that make it easy to tap into insight and apply it. We are changing the way people see things and empowering them to make an impact on the world we live in. We’re committed to a more equitable future and to helping our customers find new, sustainable ways of doing business. We’re constantly seeking new solutions that have progress in mind. Join us and help create the critical insights that truly make a difference.
  
  

**Our Values:**  

Integrity, Discovery, Partnership
  
  

At S&P Global, we focus on Powering Global Markets. Throughout our history, the world's leading organizations have relied on us for the Essential Intelligence they need to make confident decisions about the road ahead. We start with a foundation of integrity in all we do, bring a spirit of discovery to our work, and collaborate in close partnership with each other and our customers to achieve shared goals.
  
  

**Benefits:**  

We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
  
  

**Our benefits include:**  

**Health & Wellness:** Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
  
  

**Flexible Downtime:** Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
  
  

**Continuous Learning:** Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
  
  

**Invest in Your Future:** Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
  
  

**Family Friendly Perks:** It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
  
  

**Beyond the Basics:** From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.
  
**For more information on benefits by country visit:** https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
  
  

**Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at S&P Global:**  

At S&P Global, we believe diversity fuels creative insights, equity unlocks opportunity, and inclusion drives growth and innovation – Powering Global Markets. Our commitment centers on our global workforce, ensuring that our people are empowered to bring their whole selves to work. It doesn’t stop there, we strive to better reflect and serve the communities in which we live and work, and advocate for greater opportunity for all.
  
  

-----------------------------------------------------------
  
  

Equal Opportunity Employer
  
S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
  
  

If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
  
  

**US Candidates Only:** The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.

title: Mental Health Counselor (MHC-LP) Private Practice
description:
**About us:**

Soho Psychology is a thriving psychotherapy private practice located near the World Trade Center in the heart of Downtown Manhattan. We provide exceptional therapeutic services in-person from our beautiful office and online. Our clients are clinically and culturally diverse, high-functioning, and very rewarding to work with. We offer a supportive, warm, and intellectually stimulating experience, ripe for your professional development. Our clinical supervisors are thoughtful, experienced psychologists who provided guidance in Interpersonal Psychotherapy, Psychodynamic Therapy, Attachment-Based Therapy, CBT, ACT, CPT, DBT, Trauma-Focused Therapy, mindfulness-based approaches, and many other modalities. Our therapists are provided with weekly individual supervision as well as group supervision. We are a warm and compassionate group committed to helping others.

**Flexible Work Setting:**

-Hybrid Positions are available (work few days in the office and a few days from home.)  
-Fully-remote positions are also available.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide an average of 25 therapy individual therapy sessions per week (5 - 6 sessions per day).
* Timely completion of clinical documentation.

**Highlights:**

* Yes, this is an Employee (W2) position.
* Beautiful Downtown Manhattan office.
* We provide referrals so our therapists don't have to worry.
* Competitive compensation $40 - $55 per session.
* 401k plans, flexible scheduling, private gym membership.
* Supervision provided by thoughtful, supportive clinical psychologists.
* Easy-to-use clinical documentation platform.
* Receive Licensing hours toward your NYS Licensure by clinical psychologists which makes MHC's eligible for diagnostic privileges upon licensure.

**Requirements:**

* Masters Degree in Mental Health Counseling
* NYS MHC Permit Eligible.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Enthusiasm for learning and adhering to the procedures of a practice that values support, collaboration, positive mindset, and integrity.
* Excellent organizational skills, self-motivation, and a proactive attitude.
* Strong willingness and interest in receiving clinical and professional feedback.
* Strong adherence to HIPAA regulations and strong attention to detail.
* Emotional Intelligence with the ability to reliable communicate in a mature professional manner to clients and colleagues.
* Strong ability to adapt to changing procedures, environments, and people.

**To Apply:**

Please provide a brief cover letter and C.V. or resume to careers@sohopsychology.com.

Please also visit us at sohopsychology.com

Job Types: Full-time, Part-time

Pay: $40.00 - $50.00 per hour

Expected hours: 25 – 30 per week

Work Location: Hybrid remote in New York, NY 10007

title: Chief of Staff
description:
***About Dabre Family Services International Inc***

Dabre Family Services International Inc is a startup nonprofit organization dedicated to improving the quality of life of Sahelian Communities with headquarter in New York City and global programs office in Ouagadougou, capital of Burkina Faso. Through policy analysis, research, advocacy, and collaboration, we work to create a better place where our communities thrive. We address systemic challenges and advocate for policies that ensure our people have access to high-quality education, safe environments, and the resources necessary for healthy development. We are seeking a dynamic and devoted Chief of Staff to provide support to the CEO to drive the next chapter of growth and impact. We are planning to implement our first programs in eight (8) Sahelian countries.

**Job Overview**

As the Chief of Staff (COS), this position will play a pivotal role in organizing smooth operations, displaying effective communication, and providing strategic support to the CEO. The COS organizes and prioritizes critical projects, issues, and information to facilitate effective and timely decision making. The COS services as the trusted advisor and gatekeeper for the CEO, allowing the CEO to accomplish the strategic goals of the organization effectively and efficiently.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**1. Strategic Planning:**  
Assist the CEO in setting organizational goals, developing strategies, and ensuring that these plans are communicated and implemented effectively throughout the organization.  
Orchestrate and integrate activities in support of achieving strategic objectives.

**2. Performance Management:**  
Assist the CEO in the timely implementation of the CEO’s goals and ensure these goals are met in a timely manner.  
Track and report to the CEO key organizational performance indicators, assessing progress toward goals and the organization's overall performance. This includes reviewing select dashboards of information from Epic, Ceridian, financials and other sources.

**3. Organizational Alignment:**  
Ensure alignment of departmental activities with overall organizational objectives.  
Identify areas for improvement and implement strategies to enhance organizational efficiency.  
Connect workstreams that would otherwise remain siloed.

**4. Decision Support:**  
Provide advice and recommendations to the CEO with a wide-ranging point of view, conducting research, gathering data, and analyzing information to aid in decision-making processes.  
Keep the CEO informed regarding local and national health care news.  
Work closely with the CEO Executive Assistant assisting in managing the CEO’s schedule and coordinating executive-level activities.  
Create presentations and other materials for meetings such as Board presentations and town halls.  
Prepare the CEO for meetings to ensure efficiency.  
Act as a key liaison between the CEO, Senior Leadership Team and various departments.  
Manage the content of Board and Board committee meetings in collaboration with the CEO’s Executive Assistant. Ensure that Board presentations are reviewed before Board meetings. Assist in the development of an annual agenda for all Board and Board committee meetings.

**5. Leadership and Relationship Building:**  
Build relationships and credibility with the CEO's Senior Leadership Team and other key internal and external stakeholders providing them with recommendations and consultation as needed.

**6. Project Management:**  
Oversee the implementation of the organization’s strategic on behalf of the CEO by ensuring proper follow up and regular check ins by team members. Facilitate the Check in Meetings along with the CEO.  
Direct special projects or initiatives, coordinate teams, and ensure that projects align with organizational objectives and deadlines.  
Employ established project management principles including excellent time management.  
Provide attention to detail, meeting preparation and facilitation, and follow-up item tracking and resolution.  
Gather quantitative and qualitative evidence of process and project success and recommend course corrections when necessary.

**7. Communication:**  
Facilitate effective communication, in collaboration with the Chief Growth and Brand Officer, between the Senior Leadership Team and different departments ensuring information from the CEO flows smoothly within the organization.  
Draft and review internal and external communications on behalf of the CEO and the organization in collaboration with the other key leaders.

**9. Advisory Role:**  
Provide advice, insight, and guidance to the CEO based on an understanding of the organization, operations and goals.

**10. Other Services:**  
**Confidentiality and Discretion:** Handle sensitive and confidential information with utmost confidentiality and discretion, recognizing the importance of preserving privacy.  
Perform other duties as assigned.

Requirements/Preferences

* BA/BS degree. MBA or equivalent master’s degree.
* 10+ years of leadership experience with demonstrated experience directly and indirectly leading people.
* 8+ years professional experience in strategic planning, consulting, transformation, and/or operational leadership roles, preferably in care delivery.
* Experience successfully translating a vision into implementation and results as well as leading enterprise level strategies.
* Exceptional collaborator, communicator, and executive presence; ability to communicate effectively and efficiently (both verbal and written) at multiple levels of a large, complex organization.
* Deep understanding of strategy, operations, reporting and forecasting with a demonstrated ability to quickly aggregate and analyze information and draw conclusions.
* Ability to predict, quickly understand, and act on business needs.
* Highly influential, strategic thinker, willing to challenge siloed thinking and drive change at all levels of the organization.
* Highly motivated self-starter with a track record of driving programs and projects in a matrix environment with demonstrated history of successfully managing complex and scaled initiatives.
* Ability to handle highly confidential or sensitive information in a professional, discreet manner.
* Exceptionally organized with excellent attention to detail.
* Ability to be in the office and travel in Africa as needed.
* ability to speak French Language but required

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $200,000.00 per year

Ability to Relocate:

* New York, NY 10023: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Program Manager, Tech- Talent Acquisition Technology
description:
**About the Role**
  

  

We're looking for a dynamic Program Manager to join our Talent Acquisition Technology team within People Technology. In this key role, you'll collaborate with Product Managers, Program Partners, Engineers, and Talent Acquisition teams to design and implement innovative tools that drive our recruitment efforts. If you're passionate about building impactful solutions and working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, we want to hear from you! You'll report directly to the Senior Manager, Talent Acquisition Technology.
  

  

In People & Place (P&P), we focus on all aspects of people-related functions to ensure our employees worldwide are empowered to do their best work. The People Tech team drives transformational initiatives within the P&P function, fostering innovative approaches to simplify processes, tools, and systems. With a focus on scalable solutions, the team continuously seeks to improve efficiency and enhance the employee experience across the organization.
  

  

**What the Candidate Will Do:**
* Conduct data analysis in collaboration with the People Analytics team to provide key metrics supporting HR and Leadership decision-making.
* Analyze system performance metrics related to HR objectives and key results (OKRs).
* Build and improve Talent Acquisition processes throughout the recruitment life cycle.
* Collaborate with People Infrastructure and Business Technology teams to manage requirements, sprints, and system updates.
* Serve as a point of contact for service-related inquiries, triaging and escalating issues to engineering when necessary.
* Partner with stakeholders to understand and define requirements.
* Liaise with Technical Program Managers (TPM's) and Engineering teams for sprint planning and execution.
* Monitor the health and performance of systems and tools within the Talent Acquisition sector.
* Support analysis, design, deployment, and testing of new system functionalities, upgrades and patches.
* Prioritize initiatives based on available resources, impact level and desired business outcomes.
* Manage vendor relationships, including onboarding, accountability and engagement in RFP processes when necessary.
* Collaborate with Leadership to prioritize, plan, and execute key initiatives.

**Basic Qualifications:**
* 3-5 years of relevant professional experience, with at least 2 years administering or supporting Talent Acquisition (TA) tools (e.g., ATS such as Greenhouse, SmartRecruiters, Workday, Oracle).
* Experience using Jira or similar ticketing systems.
* Proficiency in Excel and Google Sheets.
* Strong communication skills, able to engage with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Knowledge of HR processes and best practices.
* Proven ability to partner effectively with Talent Acquisition teams.

**Preferred Qualifications:**
* Self-starter attitude, demonstrating initiative and a proactive approach to problem-solving; you thrive in environments where you are empowered to take ownership of your work.
* Strong sense of curiosity and a continuous improvement mindset, always seeking new ways to innovate, optimize processes and contribute creative solutions to enhance team and company goals.
Ability to independently identify areas for improvement and implement effective changes, showing a passion for experimentation and learning.  
* 

  

  

For Chicago, IL-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$113,000 per year - USD$125,500 per year. For New York, NY-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$125,000 per year - USD$139,000 per year. For San Francisco, CA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$125,000 per year - USD$139,000 per year. For Seattle, WA-based roles: The base salary range for this role is USD$113,000 per year - USD$125,500 per year. For all US locations, you will be eligible to participate in Uber's bonus program, and may be offered an equity award & other types of comp. You will also be eligible for various benefits. More details can be found at the following link https://www.uber.com/careers/benefits.

title: Office Manager
description:
**About ANS Geo:**  
ANS Geo is a leading Civil and Geotechnical Engineering firm headquartered in New Jersey, with multiple offices throughout the country. We pride ourselves on delivering innovative engineering solutions, while creating a supportive and growth-oriented environment for our team. As we expand, we are looking for an experienced and dedicated Office Manager to oversee the daily operations of our South Plainfield office.

**Position Overview:**  
The Office Manager will play a key role in ensuring the smooth operation of our South Plainfield office by overseeing administrative functions, maintaining facilities, and supporting office staff. This position will include responsibilities in facility and fleet management, financial oversight, office supply management, and coordination of key office events. The ideal candidate will have excellent organizational skills, a proactive mindset, and the ability to manage multiple tasks efficiently.

**Key Responsibilities:**

**Facility and Fleet Management (12-15 hours/week)**

* Oversee the maintenance and repair of the office building, including HVAC, plumbing, electrical, cleaning services, landscaping, and snow removal.
* Manage service contracts and coordinate with vendors for office maintenance and repairs.
* Conduct regular inspections to ensure the building's safety, cleanliness, and compliance with health, safety, and fire regulations.
* Manage the check-in/out process for company vehicles, including coordinating maintenance and repairs.

**Office Supplies and Inventory Management (3-5 hours/week)**

· Maintain and organize storage areas, ensuring cleanliness and efficient inventory management for office supplies and equipment.

* Order and replenish office supplies as necessary, keeping track of stock levels.

**Financial Management (1-2 hours/week)**

* Manage office-related budgets, including utility bills, maintenance costs, and supply orders.
* Process and track invoices for vendors and office-related expenses.

**Shipping and Mail Management (2-3 hours/week)**

* Manage incoming and outgoing mail, shipping packages, and organizing documents.
* Collect, scan, and file mail and other important documents appropriately.

**Onboarding Support (variable)**

* Greet new hires on their first day, provide a tour of the office, and assist with desk setup and building access.
* Train new hires on office policies and procedures to ensure a smooth onboarding experience.

**Administrative Support (12 -14 hours/week)**

* Assist with scheduling meetings, managing calendars, and coordinating office-wide communications for NJ-related events.
* Maintain both physical and digital office records and documentation.
* Manage the corporate vehicle fleet, coordinating with leadership for guidance.
* Assist with administrative tasks such as processing vendor forms, lien waivers, and notarizing documents.
* Greet visitors and manage the front desk, answering phone calls, and directing inquiries as needed.

**Event Planning and Coordination (1 hour/week)**

* Collaborate with team members to organize and coordinate office events, including team meetings, training sessions, and celebrations.

**Additional Office Management Responsibilities:**

* Develop and implement office policies and procedures to enhance operational efficiency.
* Serve as the primary point of contact for office-related issues, troubleshooting problems and providing solutions.
* Ensure that the office maintains a professional and welcoming atmosphere at all times.

**Qualifications:**

* High school diploma or equivalent required; Associate's or Bachelor's degree preferred.
* 3+ years of experience in office management, administrative support, or a similar role.
* Strong organizational and multitasking abilities.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, Outlook) and office management software.
* Ability to manage budgets and track expenses.
* Familiarity with facility and fleet management is a plus.
* Notary certification is an advantage.

**Benefits:**

* Health, dental, and vision insurance.
* 401(k) with company match.
* Unlimited Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays.
* Opportunities for professional development.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $85,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Flexible spending account
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Experience:

* Fleet management: 1 year (Required)
* Office management: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* South Plainfield, NJ 07080 (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: GTM Campaigns Manager
description:
At PitchBook, we are always looking forward. We continue to innovate, evolve, and invest in ourselves to bring out the best in everyone. We're deeply collaborative and thrive on the excitement, energy, and fun that reverberates throughout the company.



Our extensive learning programs and mentorship opportunities help us create a culture of curiosity that pushes us to always find new solutions and better ways of doing things. The combination of a rapidly evolving industry and our high ambitions means there's going to be some ambiguity along the way, but we excel when we challenge ourselves. We're willing to take risks, fail fast, and do it all over again in the pursuit of excellence.


If you have a good attitude and are willing to roll up your sleeves to get things done, PitchBook is the place for you.

  


**About the Role:**



The Marketing department at PitchBook is critical to fueling the company's growth by utilizing a variety of strategies to support our Sales and Customer Success departments to grow and retain our client base. The GTM Campaigns team is comprised of new sales, customer marketing, and international campaign managers. They develop and continually execute our go-to-market approach in collaboration with channel owners and stakeholders to generate demand, engage and renew customers, and ultimately grow market share with our platform and data offerings.



The GTM Campaigns Manager role will focus on customer lifecycle campaigns to drive customer growth and support customer onboarding, adoption, and retention. This role will use data and insights about our customers, the market, win/loss analysis, and other customer signals to inform development and deployment of marketing programs and campaigns. Collaboration is key for this role – partnering across business functions to define and align on campaign success metrics and measurement capabilities. This position requires a marketer who wants to continually test, learn, lean on the data, and collaborate across teams to find new and innovative ways of reaching, supporting, expanding, and retaining our customer base while ensuring our messaging to customers is compelling, consistent, and valuable across activation tactics.

  


**Primary Job Responsibilities:**


* Continually lean into a strategic, growth-oriented mindset by synthesizing inputs from multiple data sources to analyze customer behavior and derive actionable insights for improving customer experience
* Work with cross-functional business partners to regularly gauge client sentiment through a variety of strategies including win/loss data, customer interviews, and external research, to pinpoint the challenges, business needs, and unique value propositions
* Continually update and manage GTM priorities based on the articulation of customer insights, metrics, and overall desired customer impact
* Monitor key customer metrics to inform marketing strategies or initiatives
* Partner closely with account teams to understand their needs in relation to customer lifecycle stages and initiatives for marketing to support their efforts
* Partner with Product Marketing on launch and release priorities, target personas, messaging, and competitive differentiators to inform milestone launch campaigns
* Proactively inform channel owners (web, media, events, content/creative, etc.) of core GTM objectives, align holistic channel plans under GTM campaign strategy, and monitor and drive optimizations against targeted performance
* Partner with Sales Enablement to ensure Sales, Customer Success, and Support teams can speak to the in-market value proposition; ensure cross-functional teams leverage aligned content assets and messaging for each campaign
* Partner with our brand team to develop and promote the PitchBook brand, positioning, and messaging. Identify core opportunities and moments in time to generate and amplify brand awareness
* Own consolidation of GTM channel activity as it pertains to customer lifecycle campaigns. Work with channel partners to provide overarching goals, objectives, target audience details, and core messaging, enable channel partners to develop channel recommendations, then use overarching, strategic lens to finalize GTM roadmap
* Ensure consistent and fully optimized, execution of campaigns and programs through active tracking of metrics and KPIs
* Inform creation of compelling assets for PitchBook audiences to uplevel campaign touchpoints
* Project manage program and campaigns aligned to internal and external GTM initiatives within set timeframes
* Support the vision and values of the company through role modeling and encouraging desired behaviors
* Participate in various company initiatives and projects as requested

  


**Skills and Qualifications:**


* Bachelor's degree with a concentration preferably in Marketing or Business
* 5+ years of B2B marketing experience, SaaS preferred, in account engagement, customer lifecycle marketing, demand generation, or marketing campaigns
* Experience with marketing automation tools (preferably Marketo), CRM (preferably Salesforce), web analytics, business intelligence (preferably Tableau), project management platforms (preferably Asana), and HighSpot
* Experience driving marketing programs and campaigns from concept to completion within set deadlines
* Experience working with Sales, Customer Support and Product to understand and drive a business forward through effective GTM strategies
* Excellent organization skills, attention to detail, and ability to manage multiple projects
* Understanding of total addressable market, serviceable addressable market, as well as identifying new market opportunity, and how to activate them
* Maintain test & learn approach and a bias for action, to continually optimize and accelerate performance
* Strong results orientation and decision-making skills
* Expert communicator, with excellent verbal, written, visual/presentation, and interpersonal communication skills
* Ability to thrive and be agile within a fast-paced environment within a high-growth company
* Proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite including in-depth knowledge of Outlook, Word, and Excel with the ability to pick up new systems and software easily

  


**Benefits + Compensation at PitchBook:**



Physical Health


* Comprehensive health benefits
* Additional medical wellness incentives
* STD, LTD, AD&D, and life insurance

  



Emotional Health


* Paid sabbatical program after four years
* Paid family and paternity leave
* Annual educational stipend
* Ability to apply for tuition reimbursement
* CFA exam stipend
* Robust training programs on industry and soft skills
* Employee assistance program
* Generous allotment of vacation days, sick days, and volunteer days

  



Social Health


* Matching gifts program
* Employee resource groups
* Subsidized emergency childcare
* Dependent Care FSA
* Company-wide events
* Employee referral bonus program
* Quarterly team building events

  



Financial Health


* 401k match
* Shared ownership employee stock program
* Monthly transportation stipend

  


* *Please be aware the above PitchBook benefit and perk offerings are subject to corresponding plan and policy documents and may change during the course of your employment.*

  



Compensation


* Annual base salary: $95,000-$110,000
* Target annual bonus percentage: 10%

  


* *Starting pay will be based on several factors and commensurate with qualifications & experience. We also have a location-based compensation structure; there may be different ranges for candidates by location.*

  


**Working Conditions:**



We believe our business and our culture are strongest when we work together in person. We also know that it's helpful to have some flexibility to work remotely. Most roles work in the office 3+ days/week, and some are expected to work in the office 4-5 days/week. The current expectation for this role is that you are working in the office 3+ days/week and that you are in the office full-time during the training period, for which the length varies by role. During an initial phone screen, the team will discuss expectations for this specific position.



The job conditions for this position are in a standard office setting. Employees in this position use PC and phone on an on-going basis throughout the day. Limited corporate travel may be required to remote offices or other business meetings and events.

  


**Life At PB:**



We are consistently recognized as a Best Place to Work and our culture is at the heart of our success. It's our fundamental belief that people do and create great things and that people are the cornerstone of prosperity. We believe that proactively seeking out different points of view, listening to others, learning, and reflecting on what we've heard creates a sense of belonging within PitchBook and strengthens the PitchBook community.

  



We are excited to get to know you and your background. Concerned that you might not meet every requirement? We encourage you to still apply as you might be the right candidate for the role or other roles at PitchBook.

  



#LI-AD2

title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
**Hiring immediately! Apply today!**

Working at Adfast means being part of a human and technological adventure that began over 40 years ago!

We offer adhesive, sealant, and insulation solutions for manufacturers and construction professionals, personalized to local needs and supported by a team of on-site technical experts. True to our pioneering spirit, what sets us apart and reflects our DNA is imagination, ingenuity, boldness, innovation as well as excellence in chemical and mechanical engineering.

**Adfast is currently seeking a talented Field Sales Representative to expand our business in the New Jersey metro area.**

**Working Conditions:**

Schedule: Field based, Monday to Friday

Status: Permanent, Full-Time

Benefits: Health insurance, Retirement Plan, Paid time off, EAP

**Main tasks and responsibilities:**

- Identify new business opportunities while targeting key prospects to drive sustainable, profitable growth

- Develop/strengthen customer relationships with key influencers & key decision makers

- Visit construction jobsites and contractor offices to conduct product demonstrations and/or product testing

- Train customers’ product installation teams on product selection, surface preparation & product application

- Engage existing customers to create new opportunities for increased product mix, volume, and margin

- Update/maintain account information and new opportunity pipeline daily (Salesforce CRM)

- Analyze sales results; (re)define key customer potential; create-implement-adjust tactical sales strategy

- Gather, analyze, and present market data to sales leadership (applications, products, pricing, volume, etc.)

**Requirements:**

- Bachelor’s degree or equivalent work experience

- A minimum of three (3) years of field based B2B sales experience (Manufacturing and or Construction industry is a strong asset)

- Availability for daily regional travel (90%) and occasional overnight travel (10%)

- Valid Driver’s License

- Reliable transportation, clean driving record, and current auto insurance

**What you bring to the table:**

- High level of sales-driven entrepreneurship – Incumbent must think/operate with a “hunter” mindset

- Competency with sales productivity tools (Salesforce CRM experience is a strong asset)

- Strong organizational, time management, and territorial zoning skills – Creating/owning a monthly schedule

- Proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Outlook, Excel, Word, etc.)

- Exceptional prospecting & consultative selling skills – Ability to build/sustain strong customer relationships

- Strong interpersonal skills – Ability to appreciate & embrace different personalities

- Resilience, tenacity, and self-confidence when faced with challenging circumstances

- Ability to thrive both autonomously *and* within a remote, cross-functional team environment (Sales, Service, Logistics, Marketing, R&D)

- Excellent oral and written communication skills (presenter skills are an asset)

- Polished, professional presentation and an ethical demeanor

- Understanding of architectural specifications and construction design elements (an asset)

title: Clinical Oncology Specialist
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**



The Clinical Oncology Specialist (COS) position is a clinical sales role utilizing clinical oncology, pathology, customer service and reimbursement experience and expertise to support the sale of Natera's Oncology diagnostics. The COS is a strategic partner with the other Natera sales people in their territory such as the women's health and pharmaceutical sales teams to formulate and execute a plan of action. Accomplished through delivering approved marketing messages, strategic customer education, and implementing processes for appropriate patient identification and treatment management.



The territory is Long Island, NY.


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


* Learn Natera products, services, processes, policies, key internal teams, as well as competitor's products, services, policies and practices, and payer/reimbursement landscape in the territory to be effective in the COS role.
* Identify Key Opinion Leaders (KOLs), hospitals, clinics and physicians that are appropriate for Natera products & services in the territory and gain their trust and business.
* Calls on oncologists and other medical personnel to provide product information for the sale of Natera's Oncology diagnostics.
* Capitalize on selling opportunities and/or to influence physician, key opinion leaders, hospitals and clinics.
* Responsible for the sale of the company's oncology diagnostics products within an assigned territory or geographic region.
* Monitor, document and report on existing business as well as challenges and new opportunities. Escalate issues not resolved timely or to the satisfaction of the clients.
* Conduct business in an ethical & transparent fashion.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**


* Bachelor's degree and at least 5 years of Oncology experience OR associate degree and 7 years of Oncology experience.
* Knowledge of local oncology market.
* Knowledge of oncology molecular diagnostics and personalized medicine.
  


**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES:**


* Candidates have excellent communication and presentation skills, are strategic and forward thinking, effectively work in teams and are autonomous self-starter, experience in business analysis and have a command of Oncology and Healthcare business trends.
* The ideal candidate will have previous experience in positions such as Nurse Practitioner, Physician Assistant, Registered Nurse, Nurse Manager, Practice Manager, Research Nurse, or other Oncology clinical positions. Active as an OCN Oncology Clinical Nurse or ACON Advanced Oncology Clinical Nurse. Demonstrate oncology clinical & medical expertise, effective partnership with sales force, and excellent communication and presentation skills. Local Market knowledge is also preferred.

**OUR OPPORTUNITY**



Natera™ is a global leader in cell-free DNA (cfDNA) testing, dedicated to oncology, women's health, and organ health. Our aim is to make personalized genetic testing and diagnostics part of the standard of care to protect health and enable earlier and more targeted interventions that lead to longer, healthier lives.



The Natera team consists of highly dedicated statisticians, geneticists, doctors, laboratory scientists, business professionals, software engineers and many other professionals from world-class institutions, who care deeply for our work and each other. When you join Natera, you'll work hard and grow quickly. Working alongside the elite of the industry, you'll be stretched and challenged, and take pride in being part of a company that is changing the landscape of genetic disease management.


**WHAT WE OFFER**



Competitive Benefits - Employee benefits include comprehensive medical, dental, vision, life and disability plans for eligible employees and their dependents. Additionally, Natera employees and their immediate families receive free testing in addition to fertility care benefits. Other benefits include pregnancy and baby bonding leave, 401k benefits, commuter benefits and much more. We also offer a generous employee referral program!



For more information, visit www.natera.com.



Natera is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. We are committed to ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace environment, and welcome people of different backgrounds, experiences, abilities and perspectives. Inclusive collaboration benefits our employees, our community and our patients, and is critical to our mission of changing the management of disease worldwide.



All qualified applicants are encouraged to apply, and will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, age, veteran status, disability or any other legally protected status. We also consider qualified applicants regardless of criminal histories, consistent with applicable laws.


*If you are based in California, we encourage you to read this important information for California residents.*



Link: https://www.natera.com/notice-of-data-collection-california-residents/



Please be advised that Natera will reach out to candidates with a @natera.com email domain ONLY. Email communications from all other domain names are not from Natera or its employees and are fraudulent. Natera does not request interviews via text messages and does not ask for personal information until a candidate has engaged with the company and has spoken to a recruiter and the hiring team. Natera takes cyber crimes seriously, and will collaborate with law enforcement authorities to prosecute any related cyber crimes.



For more information:  

* BBB announcement on job scams
* FBI Cyber Crime resource page
company_description: Natera is driven by a passion for elevating the science and utility of prenatal testing.

title: Solutions Marketing Specialist
description:
**Solutions Marketing Specialist**



At AlixPartners, we solve the most complex and critical challenges by moving quickly from analysis to action when it really matters; creating value that has a lasting impact on companies, their people, and the communities they serve. By understanding, respecting, and honoring the needs of our employees, clients, and communities, AlixPartners actively promotes an inclusive environment. We strongly believe in the value that diversity brings to our experiences and are committed to the perpetual enhancements of initiatives, policies, and practices. We hold ourselves accountable by providing the space for authenticity, growth, and equity for everyone.



AlixPartners has embraced a hybrid work model to provide flexibility and support our employees' work-life integration. Our hybrid model combines a mix of in-person at an AlixPartners office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, with remote working options for Monday and Friday.


**What you'll do**



AlixPartners' recently launched Solutions Marketing team is a key driver of the future of AlixPartners' Marketing and Business Development ambitions. This team is focused on practical problem solving, innovation, and driving meaningful commercial results. This team now leads the promotion of AlixPartners' large Performance and Technology service line, our exciting partnerships with leading technology companies, and our evolving list of platforms our global experts develop to solve some of our clients most pressing challenges.



The Solutions Marketing Specialist position is a newly created role within Solutions Marketing and will touch nearly every aspect of the team's day-to-day responsibilities. This role will provide visibility with senior consulting leaders and involve collaboration with peers in Marketing, while working shoulder-to-shoulder with the full Solutions Marketing team. Occasional travel may be included, particularly for key industry events where this role will help maximize AlixPartners' presence. The Solutions Marketing Specialist is a full-time role in New York, NY and reports to the Head of Solutions Marketing. Paid relocation is not available.



The role calls for a talented, dynamic, and ambitious marketing professional able to blend creativity, strategic insight, and operational excellence all while managing multiple stakeholder groups in a fast-paced environment. This is an exciting opportunity for a marketing professional looking to take the next step in their career. The decisions and actions taken in this role are in pursuit of commercial outcomes that have a very signiﬁcant impact on the ﬁrm's revenue ambitions.


* Assist with implementing the firm's products and solutions marketing strategy through driving social media activation, creating business development messaging, and designing impactful imagery to support market presence building and revenue growth.
* Work with senior consulting leaders on their personal brands, including producing effective LinkedIn posts, relevant imagery, and client messaging.
* Coordinate key events aligned to Performance & Technology's priorities for driving client engagement, establishing market presence, and commercial objectives. Occasional travel may be required.
* Manage coordination and operational success for the Solution's Marketing team.
* Effectively communicate commercial and activation goals and activities with Marketing team, service line leaders, and industry leaders.
* Develop, review, edit, and proof written materials for grammar, consistency, accuracy, readability, etc. including content for AlixPartners' external web sites like case studies, articles, and product demonstration pages to deliver compelling digital experiences to the firm's clients and prospects.
* Work with the more senior marketing team member to assess performance metrics and provide insights and recommendations for campaign optimization.
* Organize and identify priority target audience lists for paid social media strategies and business development outreach through tools like LinkedIn' Sales Navigator.
* Assist with the annual marketing planning process to align growth priorities with marketing investment and ROI targets.
* Additional responsibilities as identified. This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties, or responsibilities.


**What you'll need**


* Minimum one year of relevant work experience.
* Bachelor's degree required.
* Intellectual agility for distilling high concept ideas into actions items and adapt to changing circumstances, including sound judgment as to when escalation is required.
* Ability to work autonomously and exhibit excellent stakeholder management skills, able to manage and build rapport in all directions.
* Proactive and responsive; able to remain calm and manage multiple large and complex projects simultaneously under time pressure
* An understanding of the value, purpose, and requirements of eﬀective use of social media.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English, including writing, editing, and proofreading.
* Experience coordinating events preferred but not required
* Good project management and prioritization skills.
* Experience using Adobe Creative Suite (InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator) or other graphic design tools (Canva, Figma) highly preferred.
* Core working hours are generally 8:30 AM – 5:30 PM, Monday - Friday; willingness to work outside of normal U.S. business hours as unique projects/needs arise.
* Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment; physically able to sit/stand at a computer and work in front of a computer screen for significant portions of the workday.
* Must become familiar with, and promote and abide by, our Core Values as defined by the AlixPartners' Code of Conduct and foster an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization.


*MUST BE CURRENTLY AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES. NO VISA OR IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP FOR THIS ROLE, NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. (e.g., H-1B, STEM OPT, TN, etc.)*



The firm offers a comprehensive benefits program including health, vision, dental, disability, 401K, tuition reimbursement, identity theft protection, and mental wellness support. title: Solutions Marketing Manager
description:
**Solutions Marketing Manager**

At AlixPartners, we solve the most complex and critical challenges by moving quickly from analysis to action when it really matters; creating value that has a lasting impact on companies, their people, and the communities they serve. By understanding, respecting, and honoring the needs of our employees, clients, and communities, AlixPartners actively promotes an inclusive environment. We strongly believe in the value that diversity brings to our experiences and are committed to the perpetual enhancements of initiatives, policies, and practices. We hold ourselves accountable by providing the space for authenticity, growth, and equity for everyone.



AlixPartners has embraced a hybrid work model to provide flexibility and support our employees' work-life integration. Our hybrid model combines a mix of in-person at an AlixPartners office on Tuesday, Wednesday, and Thursday, with remote working options for Monday and Friday. Travel is part of this position, but the frequency may vary based on client, team, and individual circumstances.


**The Role**



The firm's Solutions Marketing team is newly established to drive the marketing of the firm's services and emerging product portfolio. Working closely with the Head of Solutions Marketing, the successful candidate will play a central role in developing and executing the business development and marketing strategies and plans for the firm's solutions.



The Solutions Marketing Manager role has high visibility and daily interaction with Partner Managing Directors (PMDs) and Partners across the region, and is both strategic and operational, with a focus on always delivering an overall first-class service. This is a full-time role reporting to the Head of Solutions Marketing and is in New York, NY or Silicon Valley, CA. Paid relocation is not available for this position.


**What you'll do**


***Business development, marketing and client strategy & planning***


* Develop close working relationships with the PMDs and Partners within the firm's service lines and product development teams.
* Work closely with colleagues in the Business Intelligence Center (BIC) team to ensure appropriate and systematic delivery of market intelligence and AlixPartners successes; utilise the market, industry and client trend reports created to identify growth opportunities from existing and new potential clients.
* Create targeted activity plans that flow from the business plans to help achieve financial, client and marketing positioning objectives.
* With the PMDs, create individual client plans for an agreed list of target key accounts (from existing and new clients), a key component of which will be a focus on extension and expansion activity, ensuring that all relevant services are promoted to meet the clients' needs.
* Work with the wider marketing team to ensure that plans are aligned across ISLs and geographies to ensure a 'one firm' approach to clients and to business development activities.
* Collaborate with BD, Marketing, BIC, and Finance colleagues to deliver appropriate and timely management information to both inform decision-making and set and measure KPIs across client accounts and the portfolio.


***Business development activities***


* Work closely with PMDs and others to ensure that the sales pipeline is regularly updated and accurate, and that regular reporting to leadership and PMDs is action orientated.
* Take an active role in ensuring that the PMDs regularly review and execute on the client action plans for significant clients with a view to generating additional business.
* Establish and lead regular BD & Marketing progress meetings with PMDs to monitor progress on objectives, drive accountability, provide updates on activity and results, and identify new opportunities.


***Marketing activities***

* Manage, mentor, and develop team members.
* Work alongside the Solutions Marketing and Industry and Channel teams to devise and execute structured, impactful, and measurable marketing campaigns across the portfolio and to optimize wider global marketing themes.
* Where appropriate, execute on the annual marketing plan for Solutions Marketing. Activity to include all elements of the marketing mix as appropriate including thought leadership, placemats and materials for pitches, social media content, sponsorship, events, and corporate hospitality.
* Work closely with the country marketing teams and events team to ensure that all client-facing events for TMT in EMEA, are planned, organised and delivered to the highest standards.


Additional responsibilities as identified. This description is not designed to encompass a comprehensive listing of required activities, duties, or responsibilities.


**What you'll need**

* Minimum eight (8) years of B2B business development experience – preferably in a professional services environment.
* Bachelor's degree required.
* Commercially astute with a proven track record in supporting client-facing teams to grow revenue through expanding existing clients and gaining new accounts.
* Experience of working in a multi-country matrix environment.
* A recognized leader who is committed to 'trusted adviser' status.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English – essential; additional ability to communicate well in French/German – advantageous.
* Ability to speak with confidence and influence change both internally with senior leaders and externally with third party partners.
* Comfortable providing recommendations and advising with confidence to senior level stakeholders even when there is ambiguity involved.
* Great communicator – collaborate with multiple stakeholders across the organisation, interpret requirements, establish clear objectives, build timelines and report back.
* High level proficiency in Microsoft Suite – essential.
* Proven experience of multi-channel campaign management.
* Proactive in generating high quality strategic ideas to help the firm grow.
* Robust and resilient – able to navigate relationships in a high-performance environment.
* Results orientated – ensure every activity has a commercial goal or objective that guides the planning and execution of activities.
* Excellent work management skills – capable of managing and coordinating a broad and demanding, fast-paced workload in an organised, controlled, and efficient manner with the ability and confidence to prioritise as required.
* Strategic and analytical thinker, able to set and measure the success of programmes across country, industries and service lines. Ability to think outside the box – conceptualise new ideas, bring through different ways of effective communication to reach different audiences.
* Attention to detail – ensure own and others' work is to the highest standard.
* Flexible – ability to take ownership of projects, deliver on time and to budget.
* Enthusiasm and energy – a willingness to learn and possesses a 'can do' approach, with solid people skills and a team player.
* Willingness to work outside of normal business hours as unique projects/needs arise. Ability to work full time in an office and remote environment.
* Must become familiar with, and promote and abide by, our Core Values as defined by the AlixPartners' Code of Conduct and foster an inclusive environment with people at all levels of an organization


*MUST BE CURRENTLY AUTHORIZED TO WORK IN THE UNITED STATES. NO VISA OR IMMIGRATION SPONSORSHIP FOR THIS ROLE, NOW OR IN THE FUTURE. (e.g., H-1B, STEM OPT, TN, etc.)*



The firm offers a comprehensive benefits program including health, vision, dental, disability, 401K, tuition reimbursement, identity theft protection, and mental wellness support. Employees will also receive a generous paid leave policy including vacation/personal time starting at 7.34 hours per pay period, sick time up to 80 hours annually, parental leave, and twelve holidays.


*The salary range for this role takes into account a number of factors and is between $130,000 - $150,000 with potential eligibility for an annual discretionary bonus.*

*AlixPartners is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability. AlixPartners is a proud Silver award-winning Veteran Friendly Employer.*

**Adfast is currently seeking a Warehouse Associate in New Jersey!**

Schedule: Monday to Friday, 40 hours per week.

Inbounds and outbounds management

- Verify transport and delivery modalities

title: IT Intern (NYC, NY)
description:
Bombora, the leading global B2B intent data and solutions provider, is powered by the world's largest publisher data co-op. Our data allows sales and marketing teams to understand which companies are in market for their products and services and empowers them to execute their strategies across the entire customer lifecycle from prospecting, sales enablement to marketing/advertising and customer retention. We process billions of interactions to confidently identify intent signals from companies around the world.



Bombora is continually recognized by analyst firms as a leader in Intent data powering GTM data solutions. We invented the B2B intent data category and have been delivering high quality, accurate solutions ever since.



We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented IT Intern to join our team for an internship through 2024. The IT Intern will provide support to the IT department by maintaining computer hardware, managing inventory, and assisting in resolving end-user issues. This is an excellent opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a fast-paced environment while developing essential technical skills.



**You will….**


* Support all Bombora employees with Help Desk requests
* Support and maintain endpoints, printers, and A/V for users that are in-office (currently NYC or Reno) and remote
* Provide IT support for in-office meetings
* Administrate our network, cloud, and third-party services
* Configure Windows and Mac laptops (create accounts, enroll in hardware management, etc.) according to company standards


**You have…**


* Experience with any of these technologies: Jira and Confluence administration, Microsoft 365 administration, Microsoft Intune, Jamf, Google Workspace administration, Powershell
* The ability to troubleshoot end-user issues
* An analytical mindset and a collaborative attitude
* A self-motivated mindset and are attentive to assigned tasks
* The desire to learn and are currently pursuing an undergraduate degree in a field such as Information Systems or Computer Science


**Perks and Benefits**


* Competitive Salary
* Health / Dental / Vision
* Flexible Spending Account
* Commuter Benefits
* Unlimited Vacation / Paid Holidays
* Education / Tuition Assistance
* 401K / Match
* Generous Parental Leave
* On Demand Learning (Udemy)
* Team Lunches / Outings /Events (Yes! We found a way to do virtually!)
* Offices (for when you want one)


**Compensation Package**


* The salary range for this position is $20.00 per hour, up to 20 hours per week. Actual compensation may vary and will be based on a candidate's qualifications, skills, and experience.

  


**At Bombora, we embrace diversity because it breeds innovation.** Bombora is an equal opportunity employer and participates in E-Verify. Employment offers are contingent upon completion of successful background checks.
